Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hill-Cec2 (UCLL1c, XXA, cecropin, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; Variant: H14)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (82.22%) toHill-Cec1GRAVY: -0.46; Mol W: 4874.591; Mol formula: C219H350N68O58; Mol Ex coeff: 11100.Activity: Active against S-aureus ATCC 6538 (MIC >32-64 uM), E. coli ATCC 8739 (MIC 1-2 uM), P. aeruginos (MIC 2-4 uM).Discovery: A similar sequence (H14) with one additional G (which is converted to C-terminal amidation here) has also been reported in a different paper. Peptide H14 is active against E. coli ATCC25922 (MIC 3.2 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC 6.5 uM), A.baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 6.5 uM), P. aeruginosa CMCC10104 (MIC 12.9 uM), V. parahaemolyticus ATCC17802 (MIC 3.2 uM), E-faecalis ATCC29212 (MIC >25.9 uM), B. subtilis BNCC109047 (MIC 1.6 uM), S-epidermidis ATCC35984 (MIC >25.9 uM), S-aureus ATCC6538 (MIC >25.9 uM), and C-albicans ATCC10231 (MIC > 25.9 uM) (Peng et al., 2023). Updated 12/2023
Literature Information.Author: Van Moll L, De Smet J, Paas A, Tegtmeier D, Vilcinskas A, Cos P, Van Campenhout L.2022
Literature Information.Title: In Vitro Evaluation of Antimicrobial Peptides from the Black Soldier Fly (Hermetia Illucens) against a Selection of Human Pathogens.
